text: The Portuguese Beach Soccer League was a summer team sport event in Portugal. This was the result of an effort by the Portuguese District Football Associations of Algarve, Castelo Branco, Leiria, Lisboa, Porto and Setúbal, in cooperation with several local and national entities. The competition occurred between the months of May and July in four stages around the country. The biggest clubs that participated in this event were: Porto, Boavista, Benfica, Sporting CP and Vitória de Setúbal. After 2010 this competition was exctint and replaced by Circuito Nacional de Futebol de Praia. ==Winner== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center;margin-left:1em;float:left" |+ Portuguese Beach Soccer League !width="75" | Season !width="125" | Winners !width="75" | Score !width="100" | Runners-up |- | align="center" | 2005 | Porto | 4–3 | Sporting CP |- | align="center" | 2006 | Benfica | 6–5 | Sporting CP |- | align="center" | 2007 | Benfica | 6–3 | União de Leiria |- | align="center" | 2008 | Vitória de Setúbal | 5–4 | União de Leiria |- | align="center" | 2009 | União de Leiria | 5–2 | Rio Ave |- | align="center" | 2010 | Vitória de Setúbal | 3–2 | Porto |- |} ==Performance by club== {| class="wikitable" text-align:center; |- style="background:#a3b0bf;" | Club | Winners | Runners-up | Winning years and Runners-up years |- style="background:#f1f5fc;" | Benfica | 2 | – | align=left|2006, 2007 |- style="background:#f1f5fc;" | Vitória de Setúbal | 2 | – | align=left|2008, 2010 |- style="background:#f1f5fc;" | União de Leiria | 1 | 2 | align=left|2009, 2007, 2008 |- style="background:#f1f5fc;" | Porto | 1 | 1 | align=left|2005, 2010 |- style="background:#f1f5fc;" | Sporting CP | – | 2 | align=left| 2005, 2006 |- style="background:#f1f5fc;" | Rio Ave | – | 1 | align=left| 2009 |} ==See also== * Circuito Nacional de Futebol de Praia ==References== ==External links== *FPF.pt Category:Beach soccer in Portugal Bea Category:National beach soccer leagues
